title: Simulation-Based Chemistry Knowledge Visualization and Transfer Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: High school chemistry fundamentals and introductory college-level general chemistry knowledge
context.additional_context: Optimization of simulation environments considering learners' spatial ability differences

learning_goals: Learners can visualize molecular structure changes in 3D using simulation tools and explain chemical reaction mechanisms with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can apply at least two chemistry principles to real-life problems (e.g., new material design) based on simulation experiment results.

Over four weeks, learners conduct team projects (3â€“4 members) to derive trend prediction models with over 85% accuracy by analyzing given simulation data (e.g., differential equation-based models). They write a 3-page A4 report and achieve at least 14 out of 20 points on the report evaluation rubric (data interpretation, analytical methodology, results presentation, team collaboration).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
